column4: i got a new ntebook with Vista on C: and a free D: partition. Can I install xbuntunu on D: and create a dual boot menu?
i got a new ntebook with Vista on C: and a free D: partition. Can I install xbuntunu on D: and create a dual boot menu?
yes that is entirely possible, why xubuntu though if the machine can run Vista?
and furthermore, your D: drive would disappear
